title: Assessment – Mastery and Reflection
goals: Assess verb recall and translation accuracy
Reflect on diligence and steady learning
Conclude Week 11 with gratitude and praise

steps.speak: Salve! It’s assessment day—let’s start with our chant one more time: ō, s, t / mus, tis, nt.
Now say all six forms of amō.
Good! Quick quiz: What does –t mean?
Right—‘he or she.’ What does –nt mean?
Translate together: Puer portat aquam. Puella amat rosam. Agricola vocat puerōs.
Now independent translation: write or say one –āre verb sentence of your own.
Mini reflection: what helped you remember endings this week?
Faith phrase together: Deus nos amat – God loves us. We studied with diligence because God is faithful.
Closing prayer: Gratias tibi, Deus, pro studiō et diligentiā – Thank you, God, for study and diligence.
Preview: Next week we will meet the –ēre family—Second Conjugation verbs.
